channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Inside the TikTok documents: Stripping teens and boosting ‘attractive’ people
item.description: A trove of secret documents show teens’ increasingly reliant on TikTok and how executives were acutely aware of the potential harm the app can cause young people, but appeared unconcerned.
item.content:encoded:
A trove of secret documents show teens’ increasingly reliant on TikTok and how executives were acutely aware of the potential harm the app can cause young people, but appeared unconcerned.

(Image credit: Damian Dovarganes/AP)
item.dc:creator: Bobby Allyn

item.title: There’s a wrinkle — or many — in the story behind an elephant’s trunk
item.description: A bump in the elephant brain stem pointed scientists to the wrinkles on their trunks and the role those folds play in the animal’s life.
item.content:encoded: A bump in the elephant brain stem pointed scientists to the wrinkles on their trunks and the role those folds play in the animal’s life.
item.dc:creator: Ari Daniel

item.title: My parents once worked 7 days a week. Now, they’re reclaiming their joy in life
item.description: Aging can be a lifeline for immigrants, like my parents, whose life was defined by work.
item.content:encoded: Aging can be a lifeline for immigrants, like my parents, whose life was defined by work.
item.dc:creator: Adriana Gallardo

item.title: This year's 'October surprise' may be no surprise at all
item.description: It is not uncommon for political commentators to call a late-breaking story during a presidential election an "October surprise" — even when there is little evidence that it mattered all that much.
item.content:encoded:
It is not uncommon for political commentators to call a late-breaking story during a presidential election an "October surprise" — even when there is little evidence that it mattered all that much.

(Image credit: Stephen Maturen)
item.dc:creator: Ron Elving

item.title: Gael García Bernal believes that nothing ends — it just transforms
item.description: Gael García Bernal was basically fated to be an actor. He talks to NPR's Wild Card about being the best version of himself, how he thinks about death and what has surprised him about getting older.
item.content:encoded:
Gael García Bernal was basically fated to be an actor. He talks to NPR's Wild Card about being the best version of himself, how he thinks about death and what has surprised him about getting older.

(Image credit: Frederic J. Brown)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Martin

item.title: The stark divide between Harris and Trump on voting rights
item.description: Harris wants to make it easier for eligible voters to cast ballots and rebuild Voting Rights Act protections against racial discrimination, while Trump pushes for more restrictions to voting access.
item.content:encoded:
Harris wants to make it easier for eligible voters to cast ballots and rebuild Voting Rights Act protections against racial discrimination, while Trump pushes for more restrictions to voting access.

(Image credit: Allison Bailey)
item.dc:creator: Hansi Lo Wang

item.title: 'There is no home:' Floridians find helping hands after floods
item.description: Many residents impacted by inland flooding near Tampa can't return home as floodwaters slowly recede. One church in Valrico is providing food and other resources to residents in the neighborhood.
item.content:encoded:
Many residents impacted by inland flooding near Tampa can't return home as floodwaters slowly recede. One church in Valrico is providing food and other resources to residents in the neighborhood.

(Image credit: Ryan Kellman)
item.dc:creator: Jaclyn Diaz

item.title: With no running water, Asheville finds other ways to flush thousands of toilets
item.description: Since the remnants of Hurricane Helene hit Asheville, most of the city has been without running water. The people of Asheville have devised elaborate systems to stay clean and flush their toilets.
item.content:encoded:
Since the remnants of Hurricane Helene hit Asheville, most of the city has been without running water. The people of Asheville have devised elaborate systems to stay clean and flush their toilets.

(Image credit: Rolando Arrieta)
item.dc:creator: Joel Rose

item.title: 7-Eleven to close over 400 stores in North America
item.description: The ubiquitous convenience store owed its recent revenue drops to inflation, declining cigarette sales and a shift in palates toward fresh food and specialty drinks.
item.content:encoded:
The ubiquitous convenience store owed its recent revenue drops to inflation, declining cigarette sales and a shift in palates toward fresh food and specialty drinks.

(Image credit: Angela Weiss)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman

item.title: What the Harris campaign is doing to try to win over more Black men
item.description: Former President Barack Obama bluntly told Black men this week that they need to get over it if they "just aren't feeling the idea of having a woman as president."
item.content:encoded:
Former President Barack Obama bluntly told Black men this week that they need to get over it if they "just aren't feeling the idea of having a woman as president."

(Image credit: Andrea Ellen Reed for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Tamara Keith
